skillTree.localised_description: Whether it's the genuine article or a replica made for her is unknown, but Skattach claims this is the original throne of the mythical Hellmother, ruler of all Fimir. Carrying her throne are 4 of Skattach's most trusted Fianna Finmor.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

skillTree.localised_description: The shadow of the Ruinous Powers looms large, protecting those who bear their mark.
Although lacking the finesse of Elven magics, the sorceries of the north are no less potent, for they channel furious, Daemonic power.
The swamp will rise again, its inhabitants enjoying the blessings of the Dark Gods once more.
The same enchanted mist that obscures Fimir Balefiend dwellings can also be conjured to confound and horrify would-be attackers on the battlefield.
They can see the Winds of Magic's ebb and flow, enabling them to make the best use of the magical power available.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: From the mists they came, unseen until it was too late. And in the mist they vanished again, once their bloody work was done.
Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Meargh are the respected and feared witch-queens of the Fimir. Skattach is at her prime as a Meargh, having ruled over her Clan for 800 hundred years.

From the moment took on the hated mantle of the Fimir Hell-Mother, Skattach keeps a personal guard of the most elite, skilled and loyal Fianna Fimm of her clan, lest any ambitious Dirach gets the wrong idea and tries to replace her with a more pliable Meargh.

effects.description:
Passive ability: "Guardian" for Fianna Fimm units in Skattach's army
	(Lord's army)

target_if: Unit is a Lord or Hero

effects.description:
Melee attack: +10 for Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

Upkeep: -30% for Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: All Meargs naturally exude a magical mist that poisons and dazes all non-Fimir. Skattach's Mist is a particularly noxious one.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent engaged in melee.

skillTree.localised_description: After surviving an assassination attemps from one of her own Dirach advisors and subsequently being driven out of her ancestral stronghold by humans, Skattach has decended into such a state of crazed megloamania that it has empowered her already considerable magical abiltiies and natural physical resilience.

ui_effects.localised_text: Effect intensity increases with time spent in melee or casting spells.

skillTree.localised_description: Being one of the Meargh, Skattach is a fearsome sorceress, able to easily mainupalte the winds of magic, and even lend some of her magical acumen to the lesser Dirach males.

effects.description:
Range: +10% for Balefiend Apprentices units
	(Lord's army)

Missile strength: +10% for Balefiend Apprentices units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir have a natural aptitude for summoning daemons, said to come from their half-daemonic heritage. The Meargh summon Daemons with  ease, casually summoning and binding thousands of lesser daemons on a daily basis to act as servants and warriors.

effects.description: Melee attack: +10 for Moor Hounds, Swamp Daemons, Nuckelavees, and Daemonomaniacs units

ui_effects.localised_text: Summons a unit of Swamp Daemons

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: A Chaos Lord dominates  lesser beings cringe from a being that is so intently under scrutiny from the Dark Gods.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Crude they may be, the skill and might of the Fimir Warriors makes them terrifying opponents.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Boglars, Shearls, Fimm Deathquests, and Fimm Warriors units

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir aren't the fastest creatures, but they know about the value of mobility on the battlefield. Therefore they tame the faster, corrupted and dangerous creatures of their swampland homes to gain a tactical advantage.

Speed: +6% for Moor Hounds, Nuckelavees, and Bog Beast Raiders units

	(Lord's army)

Speed: +12% for Moor Hounds, Nuckelavees, and Bog Beast Raiders units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The larger and stronger Fimir are used as shock troops, with devastating effect on the enemy.

Melee attack: +4 for Fimm Mistmors, and Fianna Fimm units

skillTree.localised_description: The Fimir aren't the only monsters inhabiting swamps. Weaker or small-minded monsters are subjugated and utilized to increase the numbers of the Fimir armies.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It's hard to aim with only one eye, but the Fimir still use limited numbers of ranged troops.

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir are often accompanied by bigger, more terrifying swamp dwellers. Make no mistake though, the Fimir are the masters of these creatures and will use them with ruthless cunning.

effects.description:
Melee attack: +4 for Bog Octopus and Daemonomaniacs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +4 for Bog Octopus and Daemonomaniacs units
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +6 for Bog Octopus and Daemonomaniacs units
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +6 for Bog Octopus, and Daemonomaniacs units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Few can hope to overcome the veterans of the warrior caste in battle. Luckily they are low in number.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Boglars, Shearls, Fimm Deathquests, Fimm Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee defence: +5 for Boglars, Shearls, Fimm Deathquests, Fimm Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Starved monsters, driven by hatred and hunger. They will fight with reckless abandon against the foes of the Fimir.

Missile resistance: 15% for Shearl Scouts, Swamp Daemons, Fimm Mistmors, and Fen Beasts units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Leadership: +5 for Shearl Scouts, Swamp Daemons, Fimm Mistmors, and Fen Beasts units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Fimir are not famous for their hit and run tactics, partly because only a few who encounter them live to tell the tale.

Weapon strength: +12% for Moor Hounds, Chaos Furies, Nuckelavees, and Bog Beast Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge bonus: +12 for Moor Hounds, Chaos Furies, Nuckelavees, and Bog Beast Raiders (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee attack: +5 for Moor Hounds, Chaos Furies, Nuckelavees, and Bog Beast Raiders units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Nothing brings fear to the heart like the trembling of the ground these abominations cause with every step.

effects.description:
Armour: +12 for Balefiend Apprentices, Bog Octopus, Daemonomaniacs, and Fog-Shrine of Balor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 8% for Balefiend Apprentices, Bog Octopus, Daemonomaniacs, and Fog-Shrine of Balor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon strength: +12% for Balefiend Apprentices, Bog Octopus, Daemonomaniacs, and Fog-Shrine of Balor units (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
This one ensures that those captured in battle wished they'd died on the field, so great is the cruelty that awaits them.
"You will serve me, wretch, or you will die, there is no other option."
The bleak, brutal landscape of the far north breeds bloody, warlike tribes in thrall to Chaos' delicious, twisted power.
No act of faith amongst the Fimir can rival sacrifice of captured slaves; a dark and twisted offering in honour of Mud-Father Fimul and his children.

effects.description:
Increased experience gain: +10% for units when fighting against the Forces of Order
	(Lord's army)

Increased experience gain: +15% for units when fighting against the Forces of Order
	(Lord's army)

Increased experience gain: +20% for units when fighting against the Forces of Order
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: The Troll King's horde control the wind-whipped hinterlands of Troll Country, and may yet extend their despoiling influence much further afield.

effects.description:
Hero recruit rank: +5 for Fimir Balefiends
	(local province)

skillTree.localised_description: Such long-lived creatures develop a level of guile that mortals cannot match.
Something strange - something no scholar really wishes to discover - governs who dies and who lives in the warlike northern wastes.
Visions cloud the mind, prophesising the arrival of the enemy and uncovering every shadow in which they lurk.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +20%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +30%

skillTree.localised_description: The tendrils (and tentacles!) of the Northern Gods reach down from the poles and far across the world, twisting and corrupting all they touch.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +150
	(Lord's army)

attributes.bullet_text: This unit frightens all enemy units, reducing their leadership when nearby. It is also immune to fear. Fear penalties do not stack.
This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
Leadership is higher than 50% of base

attributes.bullet_text: This unit can move hidden in any terrain.

factionEffects.localised_description: "ME! ME! I SSSHALL BE RULER OF ALL FIMIR! THEN THE HU-MANSSS WILL FEAR USSS AGAIN! WE WILL RETAKE WHAT ISSS OURSSS! HELLMOTHER SKATTACH SHALL RULE ALL!"

effects.description: The Rancor Hold Fimir are closely aligned with the Forces of Chaos, and benefit from the Eye of the Gods and Gifts of Chaos mechanics, being able to sacrifice slaves to earn favour and rewards from the Chaos Gods.
Hero recruit rank: +4 for Fimir Balefiends

items.colour_text: At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as "Balor's Eye" a magically preserved eye said to belong to the myterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user's enemies within.

This thorny metal crown once belonged to the First Hellmother, a Meargh who united together all the ancient Fimir Clans. The Hellmother was a potent socreress, who placed many warding and magic amplifying enchantments upon her crown. Skattach has recently found the crown in  a journey to what she claims are the ruins of the Wandering Isle, the ancient lost homeland of the Fimir, and used it to claim the controversial mantle of the Hellmother.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: At the tip of this magical staff rests an ancient Fimir artifact known as "Balor's Eye" a magically preserved eye said to belong to the myterious Fimir god, able to open a rift into the Realm of Chaos and suck all of the user's enemies within.

This thorny metal crown once belonged to the First Hellmother, a Meargh who united together all the ancient Fimir Clans. The Hellmother was a potent socreress, who placed many warding and magic amplifying enchantments upon her crown. Skattach has recently found the crown in  a journey to what she claims are the ruins of the Wandering Isle, the ancient lost homeland of the Fimir, and used it to claim the controversial mantle of the Hellmother.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having been ousted from her fortress at Schadensumpf by the ever-encroaching humans, Skattach has descended into insanity. Having regrouped in the misty coasts of the northern Wastelands, she has crowned herself Hell-Mother, ruler of all Fimir.

effects.description:
Upkeep: -15% for Fimm Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)

Spell resistance: 10% for Fimir Warriors, and Fianna Fimm units
	(Lord's army)
